reasoning: Self-induced vomiting is a primary symptom of bulimia nervosa, not a distinct disease entity. Reporting incidence of bulimia nervosa from Dutch primary care study (2005-2009): 3.2 per 100,000 person-years. Self-induced vomiting occurs in 56-90% of bulimia nervosa patients depending on presentation and study population.
source: Smink FRE et al. (2012). Epidemiology of eating disorders: incidence, prevalence and mortality rates. Curr Psychiatry Rep. 14(4):406-414
